newsitem.title: USA: Assets of U.S. money market funds rose in week.
newsitem.headline: Assets of U.S. money market funds rose in week.

text.p: Assets of the nation's 651 retail money market mutual funds rose $2.02 billion to $614.11 billion in the week ended Dec. 11, the Investment Company Institute, an industry trade group, said Thursday.
It said assets of the 395 taxable money market funds in the retail category rose $2.05 billion to $500.25 billion, while assets of the 256 tax-exempt funds decreased $31.8 million to $113.86 billion.

The trade group said assets of the 317 institutional money market funds rose $8.73 billion to $310.81 billion. Of these, the 254 taxable money market fund assets increased $8.93 billion to $279.25 billion, and assets of the 63 tax exempt funds fell $198.5 million to $31.56 billion.
Money market mutual fund assets stood at $924.92 billion in the week. Assets for the week ended Dec. 4 were revised to $914.17 billion from $913.93 billion.
